title: Sequence Alignment and Classic String Matching
description: An exploration of how sequence alignment methods draw on classic string-matching algorithms and dynamic programming principles.

title: Living With “Future Shock” in Research
description: A reflection on how rapid technological change shapes research practice and long-term adaptability.

title: What PCA Captures in Genetic Data and What It Doesn’t
description: A discussion of what linear dimensionality reduction reveals in genetic data, and where its limitations become apparent.

title: What Heatmaps Show and What They Don’t
description: An examination of how heatmaps encode analytical choices, and why interpretation depends on scaling and similarity definitions.

title: What We Mean by Genetic Data: DNA and RNA
description: Foundations of Genomic Data Part I: an introduction to DNA and RNA as distinct layers of genetic data and the types of questions they support.

title: DNA Sequencing Explained: What Does Reading the Genome Mean?
description: Foundations of Genomic Data Part II: a practical overview of what DNA sequencing measures and how it differs from other genomic data types.

title: RNA Sequencing Explained: Measuring Gene Expression
description: Foundations of Genomic Data Part III: an overview of what RNA sequencing measures and how gene expression differs from genetic variation.

title: Genotyping Arrays Explained: Measuring Selected Genetic Variation
description: Foundations of Genomic Data Part IV: what genotyping arrays measure, how imputation expands coverage, and why arrays remain central to large-scale GWAS.

title: Comparative Analysis: What Each Measures and Why
description: Foundations of Genomic Data Part V: a conceptual comparison of DNA sequencing, RNA sequencing, and genotyping arrays, and how their measurement trade-offs shape study design.

title: What Are Complex Diseases?
description: An explanation of why many common diseases arise from interacting genetic, environmental, and regulatory systems.

title: What Representation Learning Means in Genomics
description: From Measurement to Modeling Part I: why raw genomic feature spaces are misaligned with biological structure and how embeddings provide a usable coordinate system for analysis.

title: Autoencoders vs Variational Autoencoders: Deterministic and Probabilistic Representations
description: From Measurement to Modeling Part II: how deterministic autoencoders and probabilistic VAEs differ in their treatment of latent space structure and representation.

title: What Regularization Means in Representation Learning
description: From Measurement to Modeling Part III A: an overview of how different regularization strategies shape learned representations, with a focus on VAEs.

title: What Regularization Does to a Latent Space
description: From Measurement to Modeling Part III B: how regularization shapes latent space continuity, distance, and interpretability when embeddings are the object of analysis.

title: Designing LD-Aware Genome Embeddings: Modeling choices and Trade-offs
description: A survey of the design constraints and trade-offs involved in learning genome embeddings that respect linkage disequilibrium structure.

title: From Variants to Effects: What Does Functional Interpretation Mean in Genomics?
description: Regulatory Variation & Functional Prediction Part I: An overview of what functional interpretation means in genomics, and why understanding regulatory effects has become central to connecting genetic variation to biological mechanisms.

title: Coding vs Regulatory Variants: Why Most GWAS Hits Don’t Break Proteins
description: Regulatory Variation & Functional Prediction Part II: An explanation of why most GWAS associations lie outside protein-coding regions, and how study design, evolutionary constraint, and regulatory biology shape this pattern.

title: KL vs MMD in VAEs: Two Ways to Regularize a Latent Space
description: A technical walkthrough of how the ELBO yields a KL regularizer in VAEs, and how MMD provides a sample-based alternative for matching the aggregated posterior to a chosen prior using RBF kernels.

title: From Sequence to Structure: Running OpenFold Locally
description: An examination of OpenFold’s sequence-to-structure prediction pipeline, focusing on model outputs, confidence estimates, and practical constraints encountered when running the system locally.

title: Reducing Friction in Genotype VAEs at 1M SNP Scale
description: A systems-level view of building scalable genotype VAEs at 1M SNP resolution, covering memmap-based preprocessing, dtype/device safety, streaming-friendly batching, composable experiment design, inference standardization, attribution readiness, profiling, diagnostics-first plotting, and fail-fast guardrails.

title: From Landscape to Loop: A Biological View of Epigenetics
description: A structured biological overview of epigenetics, from Waddington’s landscape to chromatin architecture, immune memory, and disease risk.

title: From Genotype Blocks to Systems Thinking
description: A reflection on building a block-based VAE and transformer for genotype data, exploring loss functions, LD-aware preprocessing, evaluation in biological context, and why scientific machine learning is ultimately a systems problem.
